title: 道德經
source: Chinese Text Project (ctext.org) - James Legge translation

passages.en: (The quality of gravity) Gravity is the root of lightness; stillness, the ruler of movement.

passages.zh: 是以聖人終日行不離輜重。
passages.en: Therefore a wise prince, marching the whole day, does not go far from his baggage waggons.
Although he may have brilliant prospects to look at, he quietly remains (in his proper place), indifferent to them.

passages.zh: 奈何萬乘之主，而以身輕天下？
passages.en: How should the lord of a myriad chariots carry himself lightly before the kingdom?
If he do act lightly, he has lost his root (of gravity); if he proceed to active movement, he will lose his throne.
